definition: to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

sentences.english: They easied on approaching the dock.
sentences.chinese: 船驶近码头时他们停止了划桨。

sentences.english: We stopped rowing and let the boat sail down the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我们停止划桨，让小船顺风漂动。

sentences.english: The rowers lost their rhythm and the boat lost speed.
sentences.chinese: 桨手们划桨的节奏乱了，赛艇因此慢了下来。

sentences.english: The oarsman found that the he had to pull against the tide.
sentences.chinese: 划桨者发现他必须逆水划船。

sentences.english: So the American company fired the rower.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美国公司解雇了划桨员。

sentences.english: An oar is floating on the surface of the river. I am wondering who has left it.
sentences.chinese: 一只划桨飘在河面上，不知道是被谁给落下的。

sentences.english: He pulled an oar in the winning shell.
sentences.chinese: 他在获胜的赛艇上划桨。

sentences.english: Each person has one oar which goes on one side.
sentences.chinese: 每个人在赛艇的某一边划桨。

sentences.english: The only solution is to pick one boat and start paddling.
sentences.chinese: 问题的唯一解决之道就是选一条船然后开始划桨。

definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
to hold the rudder/to hold (to take, to be at) the helm/to steer
the bow or prow of a ship
